properties.description: This initiative includes policies that address a subset of CMMC 2.0 Level 2 practices. Additional policies will be added in upcoming releases. For more information, visit https://aka.ms/cmmc2l2-initiative.

metadata.displayName: List of capabilities that are allowed to be added to a Kubernetes cluster container
metadata.description: Use an empty list as input to block everything; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Allowed container images for Kubernetes clusters
metadata.description: The RegEx rule used to match allowed container image field in a Kubernetes cluster. For example, to allow any Azure Container Registry image by matching partial path: ^[^\/]+\.azurecr\.io\/.+$ and for multiple registries: ^([^\/]+\.azurecr\.io|registry\.io)\/.+$

metadata.displayName: Allowed host paths for pod hostPath volumes to use
metadata.description: Use an empty paths list to block all host paths; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: The list of AppArmor profiles that containers are allowed to use
metadata.description: Ex: [ "runtime/default", "docker/default" ]'; use an empty list as input to block everything; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Allowed listener ports for Kubernetes cluster services
metadata.description: The list of service ports allowed in a Kubernetes cluster. Array only accepts strings. Example: ["443", "80"]

metadata.displayName: Allow host network usage for Kubernetes cluster pods
metadata.description: Set this value to true if pod is allowed to use host network, otherwise set to false; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Maximum allowed CPU units for containers in Kubernetes clusters
metadata.description: Ex: 200m; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits

metadata.displayName: Effect for policy: Azure Stack Edge devices should use double-encryption
metadata.description: The effect determines what happens when the policy rule is evaluated to match; for more information about effects, visit https://aka.ms/policyeffects

metadata.displayName: Require that double encryption is enabled on Recovery Services vaults for Backup
metadata.description: Check if double encryption is enabled on Recovery Services vaults for Backup.  For more details refer to https://aka.ms/AB-InfraEncryption.

metadata.displayName: API Management SKUs that should use a virtual network
metadata.description: List of API Management SKUs against which this policy will be evaluated.

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes containers excluded from evaluation of Kubernetes cluster policies in this initiative
Kubernetes container images excluded from evaluation of policies in this initiative
Kubernetes namespaces excluded from evaluation of Kubernetes cluster policies in this initiative
Allowed file system group ID ranges for Kubernetes cluster pods
metadata.description: File system group ranges that are allowed for pods to use; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: File system group rule for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: The 'FSGroup' rule that containers are allowed to run with. MustRunAs requires at least one range to be specified. MayRunAs does not require that 'FSGroup' be specified. RunAsAny allows any. For more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Include AKS clusters when auditing if virtual machine scale set diagnostic logs are enabled
metadata.description: For more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Include Arc-connected servers when evaluating guest configuration policies
metadata.description: By selecting 'true,' you agree to be charged monthly per Arc connected machine; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/policy-pricing

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes label selector for resources included for evaluation of Kubernetes cluster policies in this initiative
metadata.description: Label query to select Kubernetes resources to include for policy evaluation; an empty label selector will result in policies evaluated on all Kubernetes resources

metadata.displayName: Optional: List of virtual machine images that have supported Linux OS to add to scope when evaluating if the Log Analytics extension is installed
Optional: List of virtual machine images that have supported Windows OS to add to scope when evaluating if the Log Analytics extension is installed
Maximum value in the allowable host port range that Kubernetes cluster pods can use in the host network namespace
metadata.description: For more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Maximum allowed memory (bytes) for a container in Kubernetes clusters
metadata.description: Ex: 1Gi; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/k8s-policy-pod-limits

metadata.displayName: Minimum TLS version for Windows web servers
metadata.description: The minimum TLS protocol version that should be enabled. Windows web servers with lower TLS versions will be marked as non-compliant.

metadata.displayName: Minimum value in the allowable host port range that Kubernetes cluster pods can use in the host network namespace
metadata.description: For more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Required mode for Web Application Firewall policies for Azure Front Door Service
metadata.description: Mode required for all WAF policies

metadata.displayName: Required mode for Web Application Firewall policies for Application Gateway
metadata.description: Mode required for all WAF policies

metadata.displayName: Kubernetes namespaces included for evaluation of Kubernetes cluster policies in this initiative
Required Windows Group Policy setting for Network Security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos
metadata.description: Specifies the encryption types that Kerberos is allowed to use.

metadata.displayName: Required Windows Group Policy setting for Network security: LAN Manager authentication level
metadata.description: Specify which challenge-response authentication protocol is used for network logons. This choice affects the level of authentication protocol used by clients, the level of session security negotiated, and the level of authentication accepted by servers.

metadata.displayName: Required Windows Group Policy setting for Network security: LDAP client signing requirements
metadata.description: Specify the level of data signing that is requested on behalf of clients that issue LDAP BIND requests.

metadata.displayName: Required Windows Group Policy setting for Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) clients
metadata.description: Specifies which behaviors are allowed by clients for applications using the NTLM Security Support Provider (SSP). The SSP Interface (SSPI) is used by applications that need authentication services. See https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/security/threat-protection/security-policy-settings/network-security-minimum-session-security-for-ntlm-ssp-based-including-secure-rpc-servers for more information.

metadata.displayName: Required Windows Group Policy setting for Network security: Minimum session security for NTLM SSP based (including secure RPC) servers
metadata.description: Specifies which behaviors are allowed by servers for applications using the NTLM Security Support Provider (SSP). The SSP Interface (SSPI) is used by applications that need authentication services.

metadata.displayName: Compliance status to report for Windows machines with OS versions where Windows Defender Exploit Guard is not available
metadata.description: Windows Defender Exploit Guard is only available starting with Windows 10/Windows Server with update 1709. Setting this value to 'Non-Compliant' shows machines with older versions on which Windows Defender Exploit Guard is not available (such as Windows Server 2012 R2) as non-compliant. Setting this value to 'Compliant' shows these machines as compliant.

metadata.displayName: The list of capabilities that must be dropped by a Kubernetes cluster container
metadata.description: For more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Required retention period (days) for resource logs
Name of the resource group for Network Watcher
metadata.description: Name of the resource group where Network Watchers are located, Ex: NetworkWatcherRG

metadata.displayName: Allowed group ID ranges for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: Group ID ranges that are allowed for containers to use; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Run as group rule for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: The 'RunAsGroup' rule that containers are allowed to run with. MustRunAs requires at least one range to be specified. MayRunAs does not require that 'RunAsGroup' be specified. RunAsAny allows any. For more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Allowed user ID ranges for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: User ID ranges that are allowed for containers to use; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Run as user rule for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: The 'RunAsUser' rule that containers are allowed to run with. MustRunAs requires at least one range to be specified. MustRunAsNonRoot requires the pod be submitted with non-zero runAsUser or have USER directive defined (using a numeric UID) in the image. RunAsAny allows any runAsUser to be specified. For more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Required auditing setting for SQL servers
Allowed supplemental group ID ranges for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: Supplemental group ID ranges that are allowed for containers to use; for more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Supplemental group rule for Kubernetes containers
metadata.description: The 'SupplementalGroups' rule that containers are allowed to run with. MustRunAs requires at least one range to be specified. MayRunAs does not require that 'SupplementalGroups' be specified. RunAsAny allows any. For more information, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

metadata.displayName: Azure Data Box SKUs that support customer-managed key encryption key
metadata.description: The list of Azure Data Box SKUs that support customer-managed key encryption key

metadata.displayName: Azure Data Box SKUs that support software-based double encryption
metadata.description: The list of Azure Data Box SKUs that support software-based double encryption
